TopicTitle: Seeking a shuttle to dock with my in-progress MIR.

Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I am currently building a MIR in orbit in the same order as in RL. I have all the modules built, Soyuz TMA is done as is the Soyuz FG launcher.

Its looking great and when its done I would love to have a shuttle dock with it too.

Ive seen many different shuttles on here and would like to choose one to use.

So all you heavy hitters, show me what you got!!

MJ

I have a functional Space Shuttle wich has docked to my iteration of the MIR station.

The shuttle in the VAB:

Album:http://imgur.com/a/DKQsd#0

And the shuttle docked to the MIR station:

Album:http://imgur.com/a/o3nJK#0

I used the MK2 expansion mod for the cargo doors:http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/70486-0-23-MK2-Expansion

I also used Tweakable everything for more gimballing of the engines:http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/tweakabledockingnode/

And Kerbal Joint Reinforcement:http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55657-0-23-Kerbal-Joint-Reinforcement-v2-0-2-4-14

Optional is Mechjeb.

Download:http://www.4shared.com/file/jmdSVI_O...ini_Satel.html

I'm using welded parts to keep the game running as smooth as possible.

Edited February 25, 2014 by MK3424

That looks cool MK3424. I would prefer all stock and using the Three Kerbal shuttle pod though.

Im looking for a 'definiative' design.

Keep em' coming.
Does it have to look like the actual space shuttle? Including how it takes off and so on

Does it have to look like the actual space shuttle? Including how it takes off and so on

Hi Panzerknoef,

The launcher doesnt matter so much but I pretty much want the most realistic looking shuttle available on the forums.

I could try and design one but I have never made one that can fly and I will never cheat something into orbit.

MJ
The most realistic looking Space Shuttles are giant ones that won't fit the space station.

How would you feel about an SSTO Space Shuttle?

"Endeavour" Class Cargo SSTO Spaceplane Mk. V - Affectionately called "Big Bertha" by her designer, she was designed to transfer crew between the space centre and orbiting stations in a single stage, and thanks to her new cargo bay, can carry station parts and payloads up to orbit. A slight redesign, filled in that ugly space between the wings and the body. Switched the front end canards to winglets for front end lift, now has more than triple the monopropellant it had before.

I'm currently working on a shuttle shuttle replica that is as realistic looking as I can get while staying below 200 parts. I'll try to release it today.

Here's picture of it during a glide test:

Edited February 25, 2014 by Giggleplex777

If you're happy to use mods, may I suggest the Kerbin Shuttle Orbiter System (aka the Kerbin Mini Shuttle) - I started using it this afternoon and I must say that it is one of the most beautiful mods I've played with in a very long time.

Edited February 28, 2014 by SufficientAnonymity

Thanks for all the replies guys.

speedboiae86, That ssto is amazing looking but Im looking for something that looks a lot like the shuttle IRL.

Giggleplex, Yup seen yours, very nice indeed. Its on the list.

Im hoping to find some I havent seen before. I like the Turbo shuttle by GusTurbo too.

There must be others though.

MJ

Well, I've got some shuttles BUT they don't exactly look like the real thing because I don't like the space shuttles glide path which is very similar to that of a falling brick. But incase you are still interestes in my shuttles, take a look here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/68592-Panzerknoef-s-Shuttle-Pack

Sorry for no pics right here, but phones can't copy URL's so...

I will keep them in mind.

Anymore for anymore?

MJ
